annotations.description: We saw a few chances and nice plays, but the overall impression of the game is uninspiring and not hugely entertaining. The home team had more of the game. The home team tried to prevail using combination football, while the away side adopted a defensive style of play.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The players are back out on the pitch following the half time break and the second half is about to start.

We are watching a run of the mill game with only a few moments to ignite the crowd. The players surely can surely perform better, they just need to motivate themselves. The visitors played second fiddle to the home team in the first half. The home side attempts to hold onto the ball for as long as possible, while the away side focuses on defending and lets the opposition keep possession.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.

He should have done better. Neymar (Barcelona) is afforded space to connect with a Dani Alves cross, but his header from the centre of the box flies well wide of the right post.

Andres Iniesta (Barcelona) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Idriss Carlos Kameni shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.

Jordi Alba (Barcelona) serves up a nice cross, but Idriss Carlos Kameni punches the ball away.
Lionel Messi (Barcelona) attempts to threaten the keeper from a long range free kick, but his breathtaking effort flies just inches over the crossbar. It could have been a beautiful goal!
Sergi Darder (Malaga) brings his opponent down with a tackle, and Juan Martínez Munuera blows a whistle for a foul. A free kick to Barcelona.
Neymar (Barcelona) displays his superb passing ability after picking out Lionel Messi with a fine lofted pass to continue their attacking move.
